meanings.definition: The belief or doctrine that restrictions should be imposed.
meanings.sent1: Some people adhere to restrictionisms in order to maintain order in society.
meanings.sent2: The government's restrictionisms on travel have caused inconvenience for many citizens.
meanings.sent3: The restrictionisms of the school's dress code led to some creative fashion choices.
meanings.sent4: Her restrictionisms on screen time were as tight as a locked door.
meanings.sent5: The restrictionisms of the diet plan made it nearly impossible to enjoy a meal.

meanings.sent1: The restrictionisms on parking in the area have reduced traffic congestion.
meanings.sent2: Companies often implement restrictionisms to protect sensitive information.
meanings.sent3: The restrictionisms on dessert consumption were met with mixed reactions at the party.
meanings.sent4: His restrictionisms on social gatherings were like putting up invisible walls.
meanings.sent5: The restrictionisms on internet usage made it challenging to complete online assignments.
